microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest train station (look for JR or Metro signs)
Use Google Maps (excellent in Japan, works offline)
Ask at info desk or police box (koban)
Look for major landmarks (Tokyo Tower, Skytree, Shibuya Crossing)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - Tokyo is very safe. Train stations are everywhere and well-marked.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Suica/PASMO card (¬•500 deposit) - works on all trains/buses
Tap card on reader before entering and exiting
Trains run 5am-12:30am, avoid rush hour 7-9am and 5-7pm
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis (very expensive). Trains are efficient and cheap.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Taxis: very expensive (¬•1000+ for short trips)
JR Pass only if traveling outside Tokyo
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use trains for everything. Taxis only for late night or emergencies.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Convenience stores have great food.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: NO TIPPING in Japan - considered rude
Point at pictures/menu if language barrier
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 6pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask or point. Japanese restaurants are accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: Visit a convenience store for snacks
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. Tokyo is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Tokyo is very safe, but trust your instincts
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tokyo is one of the safest cities in the world, but stay alert.

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
actions: Very safe, but avoid touts in Roppongi
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'Iie, kekkou desu' (no thanks) and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - many Japanese speak some English, but politeness matters.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. Pointing at menus is totally normal.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
actions: Ask at train station info desks
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Japanese people are very helpful. Use translation apps if needed.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Find a park: Ueno Park, Yoyogi Park (free)
Caf√© break (coffee ¬•300-500, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Shibuya
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real Tokyo is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR temples OR shopping
Ask locals: 'Osusume wa?' (what do you recommend?)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Find a hidden temple or shrine
Try a random convenience store snack
Watch people at a train station
Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at an izakaya (local pub)
Visit a local market and chat with vendors
Attend a free event (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Visit a museum (many free or cheap)
Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book

microSituations.title: If you want local flavor
actions: Local neighborhoods away from tourist areas
